Adele.passage: Adele Laurie Blue Adkins (born 5 October 1988), known professionally as Adele, is an English singer and songwriter. She began writing and performing songs at age 15, and signed a recording contract with XL Recordings in 2008. After releasing her extended play 19 in 2008 and her debut album 19 in 2009, she became known for her soulful acoustic folk music and for her live performances, which often include stripped-down arrangements of her songs. Her second album, 21, was released in 2011 and became the fastest-selling album in UK chart history at the time. Her 2011 follow-up album 25 became the fastest-selling album in the UK in 2012 and 2013, and was later certified diamond by the British Phonographic Industry. Her 2015 album, 25, became the best-selling album of all time by a female artist on the UK charts. It sold over 3.4 million copies in the UK and over 20 million copies worldwide, and was the first album to sell one million copies in a week in the UK. It won the Grammy Award for Album of the Year in 2016. Her fourth album, 25, became the best-selling album of all time by a female artist on the UK charts.

Beyonc.passage: Beyoncé Giselle Knowles-Carter (/ˌbeɪəˈnɛsi/; French: [bayɔ̃s]; born September 4, 1981) is an American singer, songwriter, record producer, and actress. Born and raised in Houston, Texas, she first came to prominence as the lead vocalist of the R&B group Destiny's Child, one of the best-selling girl groups of all time. The group's first three albums—Destiny's Child (1998), The Writing's on the Wall (1999), and Survivor (2001)—are among the best-selling albums of all time. In 2004, she released her debut solo album, Dangerously in Love, which sold over 10 million copies worldwide. Her second studio album, B'Day (2006), became her second album to debut atop the US Billboard 200, and was later certified diamond in the United States, selling ten million copies. Beyoncé's third solo album, I Am… Sasha Fierce (2008) was her first album to debut atop the Billboard 200. It was also her first album to spawn four top-five singles on the US Billboard Hot 100, including the international number-one singles "If I Were a Boy" and "Single Ladies (Put a Ring on It)". The album was later certified diamond in the US and Canada, becoming her second album to achieve this certification.

Celine Dion.passage: Celine Dion (/dɪˈlɛn, dɪˈlɒn/; French: [sɛlɛn djɔ̃]; born March 30, 1968) is a Canadian singer and businesswoman who has sold over 140 million records worldwide, making her the highest-certified female recording artist in the history of music. Born in Charlemagne, Quebec, Dion began her career as a child singing on local televised specials and in local French-language musical theatre productions. She rose to fame in the late 1980s with her first English-language album, Unison. Dion found international success with the release of her 1990 album, The Colour of My Love, which contained the US Billboard Hot 100 number-one singles "The Power of Love", "Because You Loved Me", "If You Break My Heart", and "Immortality". Dion achieved further commercial success with the release of her studio albums, Falling Into You (1996), Let's Talk About Love (1997), The Colour of My Love Concert (1998) and The Best Damn Thing (2005), which are among the best-selling albums of all time, with sales of over 65 million copies worldwide. In 2003, Dion released her first greatest hits album, The Collector's Series, which included the number-one singles, "The Power of Love" and "All By Myself".

Coldplay.passage: Coldplay are an English rock band formed in 1996 in Exeter. The band consists of lead vocalist and pianist Guy Berryman, bassist and vocalist Jon Buckland, drummer Will Champion and guitarist Chris Martin. The band's current line up was formed in 1998, with the addition of bassist Guy Berryman. The band's debut album Parachutes (2000) was a critical and commercial success, selling more than six million copies worldwide. The band's second album A Rush of Blood to the Head (2002) was also a success, topping the UK Albums Chart. Their third album X&Y (2005) was the band's first to reach the top of the US Billboard 200. The band released their fourth album Viva la Vida or Death and All His Friends (2008) to widespread acclaim, topping charts in many countries and selling over five million copies by 2012. The album won several awards and was nominated for the Mercury Prize. The band's fifth studio album Ghost Stories (2014) was released to positive reviews from critics, and became their second number-one album in the United States. The band's sixth studio album Everyday Life (2019) became their third consecutive album to reach the summit of the US Billboard 200, and was supported by a world tour. The band have released eight albums, two of which have reached the top five in the United States and the United Kingdom, respectively.

David Bowie.passage: David Robert Jones (8 January 1947 – 10 January 2021), known professionally as David Bowie (/ˈboʊ. i/ BOH-ee, or /-ˈboʊ/;[a] born David Jones), was an English singer, songwriter, and actor. One of the world's best-known and most influential artists of the 20th century, Bowie was a pioneer of the 1970s glam rock movement who became a figure in 1970s and 1980s new wave and the "Berlin Trilogy" of the 1970s. Bowie was born and brought up in post-war London. He was the child of a Scottish Protestant mother and an English Jewish father. His half-brother is actor Terry Jones, and he was the uncle of actress Elizabeth Hurley. Bowie was musically precocious, and after forming various unsuccessful groups during the 1960s he rose to fame in the 1970s as lead singer and frontman of the rock band Ziggy Stardust and the Spiders from Mars. With the Spiders from Mars, Bowie released the albums The Man Who Sold the World (1970) and Hunky Dory (1971). The character Ziggy Stardust, an alien alter ego, was developed for the 1972 album The Rise and Fall of Ziggy Stardust and the Spiders from Mars. The album was a critical and commercial success and helped pioneer the glam rock style.

Houston.passage: Houston (/ˈhoʊstn/ ( listen))[nb 3] is the most populous city in the U.S. state of Texas and the fourth-largest in the United States, with a population of 2.3 million people within an area of 699 square miles (1,793 km2). Mars.passage: Mars ( ;[ˌmɑːrʃ]; from Latin: "Mars", from Greek: "Άρης", "Árḗs"; Arabic: "أرّاة", "ʼArḫōṯ"; Syriac: "ʼArḥōṯ"; Akkadian: "Araḫu"; Ancient Greek: "Ἀρκαδίη", "Arkḗdíē"; New Persian: "Ārḵadī"; Mongolian: "Аркадий"; Turkish: "Araç" or "Arac"; Pashto/Dari/Urdu: "آراچ" or "آرَڪدی" or "ارَڪٹ" or "آرِڪد") is the fourth planet from the Sun and the second-largest in the Solar System, after Jupiter. Named after the Roman god of war, it is often described as the "Red Planet" due to the rust-red appearance of its surface. Las Vegas.passage:
Las Vegas (/ ˌlæs ˈveɪɡɪəs /;[a] / ˌlɑːs ˈveɪɡəs /; Spanish:[laz ˈβeɣas]) is an American city in the Mojave Desert, located in Clark County, Nevada. Las Vegas is nicknamed \"The Entertainment Capital of the World\"[citation needed] or simply \"Vegas\". It is the county seat of Clark County and the city with the highest percentage of Asian Americans in the United States. The city bills itself as the \"Entertainment Capital of the World\", and is renowned worldwide as a major center of gambling, shopping, fine and performing arts, conferences and other special events. The city is also known for its natural scenery and weather, as well as its status as a major center of the U.
S. film industry. Las Vegas is located in a desert valley surrounded by the Spring Mountains, the Sierra Nevada (U.S.), and the White Mountains (U.S. state of Nevada). Las Vegas is about two hours drive (220 miles or 360 km) from Los Angeles and three hours from San Francisco. The city is in a basin at an elevation of about 1,400 feet (427 m) above sea level, with mountains to the east and the west.

qae_pairs.question: 1. Question: What is Las Vegas known as?
qae_pairs.explanation: Las Vegas is nicknamed The Entertainment Capital of the World or simply Vegas.

qae_pairs.explanation: The highest point in Las Vegas is the Sierra Nevada.

qae_pairs.explanation: The White Mountains

qae_pairs.explanation: Las Vegas is closer to Los Angeles than San Francisco.

qae_pairs.explanation: Artpop is the fourth studio album by American singer Lady Gaga, released on November 11, 2013 by Interscope Records.

Joanne.passage: Joanne Kathleen Rowling ( /ˈruːlɪŋ/ ROH-ling; born 31 July 1965) is an English writer and retired English teacher. She is the author of the Harry Potter fantasy series, published from 1997 to 2007. The novels have been adapted into a film series, receiving universal acclaim and attaining immense popularity.
